title: Follow-up on connection Issues - 5/03/2015
body:
Hi all,

Last night, as many of you noticed, we had another problem with players being unable to connect to games in progress for nearly 2 hours.  This was following on from yesterday morning, where a number of players were experiencing connection issues.

*Rito plz!?  What is going on?*

In short, this is not the kind of player experience we are aiming for.  We want to provide you with a stable service, and we are constantly working make sure it stays that way.

**Here's a quick rundown of what has happened:**

Yesterday, we received quite a few reports of players experiencing all kinds of connection issues.  When we investigated this, we found that there was a piece of network hardware having issues that needed to be addressed.  We were able to mitigate these hardware issues and restore our service, ensuring that yesterday afternoon & evening there was a stable game experience.

Overnight, we experienced a different issue.  Shortly after 3AM AEDT, one of our internet connections went offline due to a major equipment failure at our provider's end.  While we have multiple internet connections in place, this failure caused some knock-on effects to our game servers, and seriously disrupted our network.  This was actually quite similar to the issue experienced last week - see [here](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/NJth0tul-follow-up-on-the-server-issues-25022015). Our network engineers were able to identify & bypass the failed link, bringing the game servers back online.  

We aren't 100% out of the woods yet, as the failed connection is still down (our provider is waiting for parts arrive to their datacentre), but we are in a place where games should be running smoothly using our other connections.

**Next steps:**

These issues seen over the last week have highlighted a couple of areas that we definitely need to work on regarding the stability of our network.  This is something we are taking very seriously and working to address in the near future.  That said, changes of this nature aren't instant and require careful planning, but we are working to address the root cause of these issues as soon as we can.

Thanks for your patience.

Agent Mindstar

replies.body: Thank you for taking the time to explain what the issues were, and I'm glad to hear that Riot are working to implement more secure servers for future.
Thank you so much for that insight I am absolutely delighted to see this post as I have been wondering what was going on lately thanks again
